channel.title: Google Maps on David Hamp-Gonsalves
channel.description: Recent content in Google Maps on David Hamp-Gonsalves

item.title: Drawing Region Polygons on Google Maps API v.3
item.description: You can “draw” all sorts of stuff on Google Maps using Layers but mor simply you can also directly create polygons and with a bit of extra work make them looks pretty cool. In this case I’m tracing a country using data from the Natural Earth Google Fusion Tables Dataset. Here is the final product showing where New York is. Drawing a Polygon The Natural Earth Dataset provides outline coordinates using the EPSG 4326 projection.
